newsitem.title: USA: Northwestern Public Service to buy propane dealer.
newsitem.headline: Northwestern Public Service to buy propane dealer.

text.p: Northwestern Public Service said Monday its Northwestern Growth Corp subsidiary agreed to acquire Empire Energy Corp, a retail distributor of propane in the United States, for about $120 million.
Empire, headquartered in Lebanon, Mo., maintains 168 retail branches delivering over 100 million gallons annually to 130,000 customers in 10 states, primarily in the southeastern United States.
Northwestern said the transaction is expected to be financed through assumption of Empire's existing bank financing in addition to cash, notes and other considerations.

Separately, Northwestern Growth agreed to acquire about $10 million of CGI Holdings Inc's preferred stock. Northwestern Growth also would be allowed to acquire all of the common stock of CGI at a later date, subject to various terms and conditions.

CGI is the parent of Coast Gas Inc, a retail propane distributor serving 75,000 customers in seven states, primarily the western United States. CGI, headquartered in Watsonville, Calif., also owns Coast Energy Group, a wholesaler of propane and other natural gas liquids and a marketer and processsor of natural gas.
